title: What dangers can arise from mental associative processes in occult practices?
first_phrase: This text explores the phenomenon of dissociation in the human psyche and its relationship with automatism. It highlights the prevalence of associative mental processes over logical reasoning and how people who identify with these internal transformations expose themselves to risks in the realm of doctrine. The discussion centers around the importance of not succumbing to the apparent evidence of internal phenomena and instead exploring what lies behind them. The last 200 tokens delve deeper into the dissociation of the psyche and how it can lead to a condition favorable for self-discovery and exploration. The author discusses how dissociation causes elements of the psyche to become autonomous, thus adapting themselves to occult forces and impulses. The text then describes how this can lead to symbolic projections and even genuine visions.

L'Io è invece ciò che se ne distingue e che distinguendosene, per cosi dire se lo fa apparire di fronte, tanto da cono scerlo oggettivamente. In certi casi, anzi, questo non è un modo di dire, ma un'espressione propria: quando in questi stadi di disso ciazione l'immaginazione si trovi allo stato libero, pos sono prodursi vere e proprie visioni. Abbiamo già detto a piú riprese che queste visioni vanno conosciute come proiezioni simboliche del contenuto della psiche (quello, da cui ci si è distinti) e delle forze che si muovono nel corpo (3 ).
last_phrase: In conclusion, the dissociation of the psyche can lead to a deeper understanding of oneself through the spontaneous associations and automatic manifestations of the unconscious. However, it is important to note that the content and forces present in these states are not the self, but rather projections that must be examined symbolically. With the capacity for subjective reactions neutralized, it is possible to achieve a stage of complete emptiness where true visionary experiences may occur.
